Layout Creating Function to Add Row Total Counts

Source: R/rtables.R
add_rowcounts.Rd

This works analogously to rtables::add_colcounts() but on the rows.

add_rowcounts(lyt)

Arguments

lyt

(layout)
input layout where analyses will be added to.

Value

The modified layout where the latest row split labels now have the row-wise total counts (i.e. without column based subsetting) attached in parentheses.

Examples

basic_table() %>%
  split_cols_by("ARM") %>%
  add_colcounts() %>%
  split_rows_by("RACE", split_fun = drop_split_levels) %>%
  add_rowcounts() %>%
  analyze("AGE", afun = list_wrap_x(summary), format = "xx.xx") %>%
  build_table(DM)

#>                                    A: Drug X   B: Placebo   C: Combination
#>                                     (N=121)     (N=106)        (N=129)    
#> --------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> ASIAN (N=231)                                                             
#>   Min.                                20           21             22      
#>   1st Qu.                             29           28             30      
#>   Median                              33          32.5           33.5     
#>   Mean                               34.2        32.68          34.63     
#>   3rd Qu.                            38.5          36             38      
#>   Max.                                58           55             53      
#> BLACK OR AFRICAN AMERICAN (N=79)                                          
#>   Min.                                23           21             24      
#>   1st Qu.                             29         28.75            29      
#>   Median                              33           30             32      
#>   Mean                               34.68       31.71            34      
#>   3rd Qu.                            37.25       36.25            39      
#>   Max.                                60           42             51      
#> WHITE (N=46)                                                              
#>   Min.                                30           25             28      
#>   1st Qu.                             38           31           30.25     
#>   Median                             40.5         37.5            35      
#>   Mean                               39.36       36.93          35.11     
#>   3rd Qu.                            43.5          40            37.5     
#>   Max.                                47           55             47
